item.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the Federal excise tax on heavy-duty trucks should not be increased.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3103-3104)

summary.text: Declares that the federal excise tax on new tractor trailer trucks, heavy duty trucks, and certain truck trailers should not be increased and that Congress should review the detrimental impacts of such tax in considering future transportation policy.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that the Federal excise tax on heavy-duty trucks should not be increased.

item.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that the Federal excise tax on heavy-duty trucks should not be increased.
A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that the Federal excise tax on heavy-duty trucks should not be increased.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3103-3104)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
